Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer
Five more runs followed in the third inning
Starling Marte's fourth hit of the game
Francisco Lindor's leadoff walk and subsequent triple
Pete Alonso's three-run home run in the bottom of the first
Andy Pages hit two home runs
Mookie Betts hit a solo home run in the sixth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets were on the good side in Game 5, notching a 12-6 victory on Friday in New York
Flaherty labored through three innings, but L.A. replaced him with mop-up man Brent Honeywell Jr.
The Dodgers could have been more aggressive in pulling Flaherty, but they clearly decided to do whatever it took to get through the game without using their better bullpen arms
The Mets decided to take no chances, using set-up man Ryne Stanek and closer Edwin Diaz for the final 12 outs of the game
Post-Match Reflections: Twenty-four hours after they looked all but defeated, the Mets have a path to a stunning comeback â€” their latest stunning comeback
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was not over after the third inning, though. While the Dodgers were austere with their bullpen, their vaunted offense still did enough damage against the Mets' middle relief to pull within a grand slam in the sixth inning
The series will now head back to Los Angeles, where a more favorable matchup awaits the Mets in Game 6
The Dodgers could have rested Flaherty for Game 6 but opted to use him tonight, which means it will likely be a bullpen game against Sean Manaea, who had a great start in Game 2
